name: Decarabian
desc: The God of Storms and the ruler of Old Mondstadt. He was overthrown as a result of an uprising raised by the people of Mondstadt, who could not withstand the tyranny.

customize.text: 3000 years ago, Old Mondstadt (now Stormterror's Lair) was ruled by Decarabian, the God of Storms. There was a war between the Lord of the Tower, Decarabian, and the King of the North Wind, Andrius. It was a time when Mondstadt was a frozen wasteland, and nothing could survive outside the Old Mondstadt. Tired of the attacks of the God Andrius, Decarabian built a wall of storms around his capital, so that the King of the North Wind could not break through. Decarabian believed that he protected his people and that the people worshiped him out of love, but in reality, they lived in tyranny, restrictions, and fear. Each resident of the city was assigned their own role; songs and music were forbidden; and people’s backs did not straighten due to the raging winds.

One day, about 2,600 years ago, people could not withstand the tyranny of the Lord of the Tower anymore, and an uprising began, started by the Nameless Bard; Decarabian's former beloved, Amos; Gunnhildr, the daughter of the clan chief; a red-haired warrior; and an Anemo spirit. The tyrant was defeated by Amos's arrow, Amos herself and the Nameless Bard fell in battle, and the spirit absorbed the powers of the deceased Archon and became the new Anemo Archon Barbatos, taking on the appearance of the Nameless Bard. Gunnhildr was the one who decorated the victorious Anemo Archon with laurels.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Barbatos
customize.desc: The Anemo Archon of Mondstadt.

customize.name: Tile of Decarabian's Tower
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The place now known as Stormterror's Lair was once the capital city of Decarabian, the God of Storms. Since this dream of prosperity was created entirely by his divine might, the broken pieces left behind by the shattering of that dream still possess great power.

customize.name: Debris of Decarabian's City
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Decarabian, the God of Storms, was content with the capital city he had raised, and accepted the worship of the people from atop his tower. But he knew not that the people did not bow to him out of respect or adoration.

customize.name: Fragment of Decarabian's Epic
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
Andrius once declared war upon Decarabian, but failed to even scratch the capital of the Lord of the Tower. If it were not for the song of freedom that shattered the city in an instant, Decarabian's dream would have gone on forever.

customize.name: Scattered Piece of Decarabian's Dream
customize.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The people did not bow to Decarabian out of respect or adoration, but because the harsh winds had laid them low. This was the shattered dream and ambition of the Anemo Archon before the rise of Barbatos.
He tried so hard to make his dream come true, and so the fragments of that dream are still mighty.

customize.name: Amos' Bow
customize.desc: An extremely ancient bow that has retained its power despite its original master being long gone. It draws power from everyone and everything in the world, and the further away you are from that which your heart desires, the more powerful it is.

customize.name: Song of Broken Pines
customize.desc: A greatsword as light as the sigh of grass in the breeze, yet as merciless to the corrupt as a typhoon.

customize.name: Freedom-Sworn
customize.desc: A straight sword, azure as antediluvian song, and as keen as the oaths of freedom taken in the Land of Wind.

customize.name: Sacrificial Sword
customize.desc: A ceremonial sword that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

customize.name: Sacrificial Bow
customize.desc: A ceremonial hunting bow that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

customize.name: Sacrificial Greatsword
customize.desc: A ceremonial greatsword that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

customize.name: Sacrificial Fragments
customize.desc: A weathered script, the text of which is no longer legible. A cursed item eroded by the winds of time.

customize.name: Barbatos
customize.desc: The Anemo Archon of Mondstadt.

customize.text: An Anemo elemental lifeform, who absorbed the power of defeated Decarabian and became the new Archon.

customize.name: Andrius
customize.desc: The Great Wolf King of the North, a protector of Wolvendom and one of the Four Winds.

customize.text:
The Great Wolf King of the North, who waged a war with Decarabian about 3000 years ago.
Amos
Decarabian's former beloved, who participated in the rebellion against him.
